intro: Lepidium minor, commonly known as field cress, is an annual or biennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and alternate, pinnately divided leaves. The small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. It produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This plant is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
